resources.string: This app monitors failed login attempts. If too many attempts in a row are detected, the device is immediately shut down.\nN.B. A PIN which is too short (i.e. three digits or less), is considered as invalid and not as wrong. This will not lead to shutdown.
In order to count the number of failed login attempts, you have to register this app as a device administrator.
How many failed login attempts before shutdown?
Here you can specify which command is executed as root to shutdown the device.\nThe default value is \'reboot -p\'.\nAnother option might be \'svc power shutdown\'.
Last shutdown due to wrong PIN: \n
Your device does not seem to be rooted. This app will not work.
